newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Clarify falls.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Clarify falls.

text.p: Computer software provider Clarify Inc fell in after-hours trading to 7-1/8 from a close of 16-3/4 on the Nasdaq following the release of its quarterly earnings, dealers said Tuesday.
"It's quite a drop," in the stock, one trader said.
"It's getting ruined," said another after quoting the stock at an even lower 6-3/4 a little later in the afternoon.

Clarify reported a first quarter profit of $0.09 a share against $0.04 for the same period a year ago. But it said it expected "little, if any" revenue growth rate for the second quarter over the first quarter, which totaled $19.4 million.
"Expanding our sales force is a challenge," it said.
Bay Networks Inc, which also reported quarterly earnings, was trading at 18-1/4 against the 18-1/8 at which it closed on the New York Stock Exchange, a third trader said.
Bay had a nil share profit for its third quarter, after a charge of $0.10 a share, against a profit of $0.15 a year ago.

Sun Microsystems Inc, which also released earnings, was hovering at 29-1/2 compared to its close of 29-3/8 on the Nasdaq. It reported a third quarter share profit of $0.58 against $0.37 the previous year.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 515,600 shares against Monday's 30,600.
Session two had volume of 2,927,600 shares. It was inactive the previous day.
